summary: Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP), formerly North West Frontier Province, is a province in northwestern Pakistan. It's the fourth largest by area and third largest by population. KP shares borders with other Pakistani provinces and Afghanistan. The province has a diverse landscape, including mountains, valleys, and plains. It's home to various ethnic groups, mainly Pashtuns. Historically important, it was once a center for Buddhism and has seen many invasions due to its location near the Khyber Pass. In 2010, its name was changed, and in 2018, it merged with the Federally Administered Tribal Areas (FATA).
title: Khyber Pakhtunkhwa
